moves.1. d4: I'll anotate this game, for it seems to illustrate some chess strategical principles : open file, center...
moves.2... e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 O-O 5. a3 Bxc3: This move comes to early in the game : none of both coulours is fully developped.
moves.10... dxe5 11. Qxe5: Taking with tege knight would have meant 11... Bxg2 - White is one pawn up but the queen will be harrassed
moves.11... Re8: now, a few moves tp contain black and save the queen.
moves.12. Qg3: The queen has to stay on black squares - then, a couple of positionnal moves (we are still in the opening).
moves.12... Nc6 13. O-O Qc8 14. b3 Ne4: Once agai, this attack might have been to early. Both caps are not fully develloped.
moves.15. Qf4 Ne7: White has to save his queen.
moves.16. Qe5 Ng6 17. Qb2: Queen in safe, the defense is ok. No counter attack possible (white is not fully developped).
moves.17... c5: A weak move - moving the queel no join the rooks would have been better.
moves.18. Bd2: Now begins the fight for the open file.
moves.18... Qf5: Bold attack but the black queen will be soon under harass.
moves.19. Bc3: strong menace - aiming at the center which is under black control. The fight for the open d file and consequently the center will occupates most of the time, from now on.
moves.19... Nxc3 20. Qxc3 Rad8: The control of the d file is vital.
moves.21. Rfd1: White cannot let black take control of the d file ( and, consequently the center).
moves.22. Rd2: If black takes, white will control the d file.
moves.22... Rd7 23. Rxd7 Qxd7 24. Rd1: Now, white controls the d file.
moves.24... Qf5: The following moves are fight for the center.
moves.25. h3: The g4 square, proved to be an important one further in the game.
moves.25... Bxf3: Probably a mistake. Black's attacking possibilities are ùore reduced than white's defensive capacity.
moves.27... g6: Doubtfull move, which weakens the black king (the white queen holding firmly the long black diagonal).
moves.30... Qe6: Only move to save the knight - now white has a better control on the center.
moves.31... h5: Black nas not plenty of options.
moves.32. Bd5: Settling at the center and beginning of the final attack.
moves.32... Qc8: Crucial move. 32. Qd6 and 32. Qd8 would have loss the queen. 32. Q d7 was bettre but it wouldn't have changed much.
moves.33... Rd8: Not the best move - mate in 3.
